info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 01 at 7:31PM EDT until May 01 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL MONONGALIA...SOUTHEASTERN WETZEL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES... At 731 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles east of Jacksonburg, or 8 miles west of Mannington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Mannington, Smithfield, Rachel, Metz, and Curtisville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
